patient_info: Muscle weakness,Pericardial effusion,Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology,Palpitations,Vomiting,Abdominal pain,Dyspnea,Exercise intolerance,Poor appetite,Vascular tortuosity,Atrial fibrillation,Tricuspid regurgitation,Pedal edema,Right bundle branch block,Abnormal ST segment,Left ventricular systolic dysfunction,Right atrial enlargement,Increased circulating NT-proBNP concentration,Left atrial enlargement,Abnormality of internal jugular vein
golden_diagnosis: Cardiomyopathy, familial restrictive, 1,家族性/特发性限制型心肌病/Familial/Idiopathic restrictive cardiomyopathy,Cardiomyopathy, familial restrictive, 3,Cardiomyopathy, dilated, 1KK,Cardiomyopathy, familial hypertrophic, 26
predict_diagnosis:
1. Myasthenia gravis
2. Inflammatory myopathy (e.g., polymyositis or dermatomyositis)
3. Neuromuscular disorder (e.g., Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease or muscular dystrophy)
4. Cardiomyopathy (e.g., hypertrophic cardiomyopathy or arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy)
5. Heart valve disease (e.g., rheumatic heart disease or congenital heart disease)
6. Endocarditis
7. Pericarditis
8. Thoracic outlet syndrome
9. Gastrointestinal disorder (e.g., gastroparesis or irritable bowel syndrome)
10. Venous disease (e.g., chronic venous insufficiency or deep vein thrombosis)

Please note that this list is not exhaustive, and further evaluation and testing will be necessary to narrow down the final diagnosis. The presented symptoms and findings could be related to multiple conditions, and it is essential to consider rare and common disorders in the differential diagnosis.
